thread.title: McDonald's across US close in protest at President Trump's immigration policies
thread.title_full: McDonald's across US close in protest at President Trump's immigration policies

author: Yahoo News UK
title: McDonald's across US close in protest at President Trump's immigration policies
text:
View photos
Protests closed McDonald’s across the US (Rex) More Do you want a protest with that?
McDonald’s restaurants in the US closed their doors to protest against Donald Trump’s immigration policies.
The “Day Without Immigrants” protest also involved other restaurants and grocery stores.
It urged foreign-born workers in the US to refuse to participate in the US economy for a day.
MORE: How to turn Trump’s tweets into childish scribbles
MORE: Passengers escorted off Easy Jet flight after shouting “Allahu Akbar”
View photos
Services were affected across the US (@FoxNashville/Twitter) More They were protesting against President Trump’s promise to build a wall on the US-Mexican border and the travel ban on seven Muslim countries.
Hundreds of restaurants were closed across the country.
It was unclear if McDonald’s voluntarily close restaurants as part of a planned protest or because workers did not show up.
People took to social media to highlight which restaurants and stores were closed.
View photos
Protesters were campaigning against the President’s immigration policies (Rex) More “The purpose of the protest is to show just how disruptive immigration changes by the government could impact consumers’ everyday life,” Darren Tristano, president of research and consulting firm Technomic, told CNBC.
“For McDonald’s franchisees and company stores, it is likely best to close the restaurant versus trying to manage the restaurant with an inadequate service staff. Although many customers will see this is an inconvenience, many will understand.”
